alert.note: Alert for Caddo; De Soto (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 10:45AM CDT until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana... Cypress Bayou At Wallace Lake affecting De Soto and Caddo Parishes. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Bayou At Wallace Lake. * WHEN...Now through next week. * IMPACTS...At 149.0 feet, Expect some minor lowland flooding with overflow beginning to affect some secondary roadways around the southern Kingston Road area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 150.0 feet. - Forecast...The lake is forecast to rise above flood stage by early this evening and crest at 152.0 feet Saturday evening. The lake will slowly fall below flood stage by the middle of next week. - Flood stage is 151.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 152.8 feet on 02/4/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1030 AM CDT.
